185922872.review:
So, this might actually be my favorite Total War game.

I know, I know...someone is recoiling at the thought that I didn't say it was the original, Atilla, etc...but this one just works for me. I don't think Rome I could have had a more worthy successor, all things considered. Did it have a poor launch and could there be some more improvements to make it even better? Yes, and yes...but even now after Warhammer and all the rest, I hold this one to be the Modern Total War Gold Standard.

I've played it so much over the years since launch. I don't even know how many hours since they kept getting reset back in the day, but going by the current tally I know it is A LOT. The controls and combat are pretty intuitive for [i]old[/i] Total War players like myself and for the more modern players. In fact, a lot of the systems you see in later titles got their starts here, so if nothing else Rome II has that going for it.

The setting is just a really dynamic period in history and lends itself well to being able to experience completely different playstyles with the varying factions. There are other Total War games where, as a consequence of when and where they are set, you really all just fight with the same roster of units. That is not the case here. Yes, there are plenty of reskins to be found, but even those aren't always 1:1. The "jack of all trades" faction here is, unsurprisingly, Rome. Meanwhile, there are other factions whose rosters focus on more niche that really make them play completely differently. There are some factions that pretty much only rely on cavalry while others heavily encourage long lines of pikes and hoplites. This alone makes the game very replayble since you can hop into something very different whilst keeping all of the familiarity of all of these modernized Total War mechanics...at least modernized circa the last major update.

The campaign map is a fun strategy-management game in of itself, but the battles are where things really shine. You have land and naval combat here, something that wasn't possible in the original title, but had to come from the likes of Empire: Total War. Combat here doesn't play like that other game, though. It is much more of the time focusing on boarding, ramming, and burning. Once on land, combat feels fairly satisfying. You can really develop good strategies with certain army rosters. The AI is, well, still AI, but overall it does tend to give you a reasonable enough challenge. Of the Total Wars, this one is definitely in the decent to good AI camp.

I can't really speak for the multiplayer quality, as it is not something I ever really participated in; however, I can point to the fairly reliable number of active players as indication that, at the very least, there are always people in the greater Rome II community to engage with.

Yes, I could really go on and on about this game, but if there were only one thing I could leave you with it would be this:

I have played every total war game (except Three Kingdoms and that weird mobile one, but I digress), and out of all of those games THIS is the one that I always come back to. I just think it is neat.

With all this said, [i]I highly recommend picking this up,[/i] but if you do so I do recommend going ahead and getting it in a bundle with the DLCs...on sale, preferably. 

It's not that the base game is barren without the extra content; but, as someone who has put hundreds of hours into it, I really can't imagine playing the game without that extra content.

[b][i]Vae victis![/i][/b]

185563880.review:
1：优化好 这一代的战场滤镜和配乐算得上经典了
2：内政复杂【相对】内战系统对于老玩家来说 算后期不错的乐趣了，一同幕府2的包围网
3：战斗节奏慢，骑兵弱，战象战车看技术
4：兵种克制关系不明显【节奏慢】，且看似兵种多，国家多，实则按照文化类型区分兵种【泛希腊，东方，游牧】，兵种差距不大
5：腐败，腐败问题在于地区越多，帝权等级越高，腐败越大，兵种维护费用越高，如果玩家不管腐败【内政升职】那么腐败度会来到恐怖的100多【倒扣粮食】
6：AI弱智，极难难度仅仅难在ai刻意针对玩家【故意打游击】公共秩序和文化转换惩罚高【开局0民忠】战斗难度倒是提升不大，一如既往的傻
7：科技和兵种的详情界面都做了很详细的史料，解释/文本量很大
吐槽一下，为什么托勒密有加拉太皇家卫队而加拉太本家没有？

185086905.review:
2002年出生的我，很小的时候便接触totalwar系列了，还记得接触的第一部应该是幕府二，随后应该就是罗马二和拿战、帝战了，时间已经记不清了，但还记得那时候在什么国王游戏盒子下载了全面战争，随后便入了这个坑。在我心中最好的三部全面战争就是罗马二、幕府三部曲和拿战了，拿战主要是题材、排队枪毙和18-19世纪初海战很喜欢，但我的印象里机制是不如罗马二和幕府的。还记得小时候，应该是小学便用家里的杂牌电脑游玩全面战争，那时候最喜欢的是方针枪兵围成空心方阵看重骑兵冲上来白给，即使到了将军中也喜欢看枪衾戳旗本众LOL，如今研究生了，心血来潮下回来了18年还是19年补票的罗马二，发现还是那么好玩，记忆里恢弘大气的战斗场面依旧可以震惊到我，真的是很好的一款游戏，我相信还是会在人生中不断重拾起来玩上一阵子，在扮演中获得脑海中最激烈的幻想，伟大的罗马，万岁！

顺带提一句，感谢蒹葭汉化组，你们的汉化让我的童年更加精彩！让一个热爱历史与战争史的孩子可以扮演自己心目中的英雄们.

184929115.review:
With over 1200 hours under the belt, I think "better late than never" is appropriate for this review. 

Despite the numerous issues that took place on launch, and for some time after, I have always found myself returning to this Rome 2. Say what you will about some aspects of it in a negative light, I cannot help but find this game draws me back regardless, and still somehow entertains me greatly. 

The community have created a wondrous array of mods and additional content that adds new insights and challenges. My current favourite mod to play is the 'Colossal Unit Size Mod (x3 For All)' which really helps to turn the battles into a scene of chaos (as long as your PC can handle tens of thousands of soldiers on the field at once!). 

I wouldn't say the faction packs really add anything (or at all) to Rome 2, but at least a couple of the expansion campaigns are worth trying for something a little more focused, if the Grand Campaign gets a little repetitive for you. 

Overall, I'd give Rome 2 an 7.5/10.

184783683.review: Probablemente el Total War histórico más mítico. Lo recomiendo por la resistente comunidad multijugador que aún existe y por por tener una campaña en el modo historia convincente (aunque se note que es un poco antiguo por su IA y detalles gráficos). Si te gusta el contexto histórico en el que se ambienta, creo que te merece la pena.

184771668.review:
First time delving into the Total War series. I've been a watcher for years but finally decided to invest this Christmas. It's just over a week and I've got 25 hours. This may not sound like a lot but considering most of my other games have only around 50-100 hours and I've owned them for much longer. Even years after it's (botched) release, this game still stands up. When I finish my current Rome campaign, which I'm around 100 turns into, I plan to venture into the workshop and download mods such as Divide et Impera.
TL:DR: Its like a 7/10 and has distracted me for a week and I plan to go further.

184548737.review: Ich hab mir das spiel vor 2 Tagen geholt und jetzt schon 14 Stunden. Es ist einfach massiv geil! Die Mischung aus echt coolen, großen und realistischen Schlachten und einer rundenbasierten Kampagne ist einfach nur episch. Man kann aber auch einfach Spaß in benutzerdefinierten Gefechten haben, denn es gibt eine riesige Anzahl an Maps, Einheiten, Fraktionen und außerdem können pro Spieler bis zu 40 Einheiten eingesetzt werden, das entspricht ungefähr 40000 Soldaten. Einfach nur cool. Es macht süchtig und man kann einfach nicht aufhören. Das beste Strategiespiel aller Zeiten!

184230765.review:
This is the beginning of the downfall of TW franchise. This is the game with which they adopted the abhorrent monetisation model they use up til this day. This is the game that started their trend of releasing unfinished games. And this is also the game with which CA started dumbing down their games. 

That being said however, this is still a good enough of a game that I can recommend it, but beware of any released after this.

184095638.review: It is a great game but like all strategy games it lacks intelegence in its commanders and just speeds up resource gathering to increase the hardness of the game. The lazy programmer method. To make it the best game ever, the game should have levels of hardness similar to chess where the game plans more moves ahead as your level increases. The generals should perform strategies like those taught at military colleges. The more experience a general has the more tacticts are available for him (AI & you) to use. This would create a game of logic instead of efficiency.

183647089.review: 垃圾，本体画质死烂，光线像粪便，打什么MOD都没用，十年前不知道谁传在百度上一个非常好的画质修改器，才发挥出了这个游戏的巅峰，但这个巅峰直接影响到了其它游戏的销量，因为效果是在太好了，后期游戏都是几个人的小组制作，技术上很多残缺不全，一比较保准你2小时内退货退款，所以想让后面卖的好，这个百人团队打造的罗马2就必须死。也就玩了没多长时间，这个修改器就被下架了，游戏还做了更新，不再兼容这个修改器，又回到很烂的画质上，很明显就是故意甩掉一群忠实玩家，刺激消费新游戏，这就像吸毒一样，游戏本体就是喝酒，在你喝的陶醉时他们给你吸了一口冰毒，你刚上头准备长期钻研这个游戏，他们就把毒品拿走了，你刚喝这瓶酒喝死也喝不出那种感觉来了，这时候你十分难受，不知道再玩点啥好，于是你就开始在游戏商店里盲目消费寻找那种上头的感觉....

183539610.review:
An excellent historical strategy game with a robust gameplay mechanic. The graphics and gameloop hold up reptty well by today's standards. It's a more elaborate game than Rome: Total War 1 in terms of politics and administration mechanics, but it doesn't have the same learning curve as Crusader Kings.
The world map is fantastic and easy to navigate and the tactical combat is as exciting as the bes games in the series and other RTS games. I find the naval combat mechanics a bit lacking.

Overall, a very fun game, 8/10
